messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Uniforms
messages.msgSnippet: I actually have a book that has a haori pattern in it.   I got it through Crafter s Choice book club, but Amazon probably has it. Making Kimono and Japanese
messages.messageBody:
I actually have a book that has a haori pattern in it. I got it
through Crafter's Choice book club, but Amazon probably has it.

"Making Kimono and Japanese Clothes" by Jenni Dobson.
Batsford/Chrysalis Books
ISBN: 0-7134-8903-0

Sadly, no gi or hakama patterns. :-( Hope this helps even a little.

--L.

messages.subject: Re: Uniforms
messages.msgSnippet: http://sarcasm.fanfic.org/hakama_pattern.jpg (Pattern), http://www.shinzen-dojo.net/le_dojo/hakama/mettre_hakama.html (How to put hakama on. In French, but has
messages.messageBody:
http://sarcasm.fanfic.org/hakama_pattern.jpg (Pattern),
http://www.shinzen-dojo.net/le_dojo/hakama/mettre_hakama.html (How to
put hakama on. In French, but has pictures, so the text is unnecessary).

-M.

messages.subject: Uniforms
messages.msgSnippet: Hey, I was wondering does anyone know how to make a Shinsengumi uniform? I don t want to buy one, I want to try to make one (or four) for that skit I m trying
messages.messageBody:
Hey, I was wondering does anyone know how to make a Shinsengumi
uniform? I don't want to buy one, I want to try to make one (or four)
for that skit I'm trying to put together.
If anyone can tell me where I could get, or how I can make a pattern
for the uniform (or a pattern for gi and hakama) that would be very
helpful. Heck, I need to learn how to tie hakama!
--A-chan
